translation1: "All Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools are carefully inspected, tested, and subject to the strict controls of Bosch quality assurance. Bosch therefore provides a guarantee for Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools. The warranty claims of the buyer from the purchase contract with the seller, as well as any legal rights, are not restricted by this guarantee.For these tools, we provide warranty according to the following conditions: We provide warranty in accordance with the following regulations (Nos. 2-7) by repairing the defects in the tool that are demonstrably due to a material or manufacturing error within the warranty period. The warranty period is 24 months, 12 months for commercial or professional use or equivalent wear and tear.The warranty period begins with the purchase by the original buyer. The relevant date is the one on the original purchase receipt. For all blue, commercial electric and precision tools (excluding high-frequency tools, industrial battery-powered screwdrivers, and pneumatic tools) purchased after September 1, 2004, the warranty period is extended to 36 months if the buyer registers these tools within 4 weeks of the purchase date.Battery packs and chargers, as well as any accompanying accessories, are excluded from this guarantee extension. Registration can only be done online at [www.bosch-pt.com/warranty](http://www.bosch-pt.com/warranty). As proof, the registration confirmation must be printed immediately, as well as the original purchase receipt, which shows the date of purchase.A registration is only possible if the buyer agrees to the storage of his data entered there. The following are excluded from the guarantee: parts that are subject to wear and tear due to normal use or any other natural wear and tear, as well as defects in the tool that are due to normal use or any other natural wear and tear, anomalous environmental conditions, foreign operating conditions, overloading, or insufficient maintenance or care. Defects in the tool caused by the use of non-Bosch spare parts, accessories, or replacement parts.Tools that have undergone changes or additions. Minor deviations from the desired state that are insignificant for the value and usability of the tool. The remedy for the defect we recognize as warranty-worthy is carried out in such a way that we repair the defective tool free of charge or replace it with a flawless tool (possibly also a subsequent model).Replaced tools or parts become our property."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "4", "Explanation": "The text is mostly fluent with minor errors that do not significantly impact the comprehension of the text. The use of 'defects in the tool that are due to normal use or any other natural wear and tear' is repeated in the sentence 'defects in the tool that are due to normal use or any other natural wear and tear, anomalous environmental conditions, foreign operating conditions, overloading, or insufficient maintenance or care.' which is unnecessary and makes the sentence appear redundant. Also, the phrase 'The remedy for the defect we recognize as warranty-worthy is carried out in such a way that' could be improved for better fluency as the current wording is somewhat awkward. However, these are relatively minor issues and the overall message and meaning of the text is clear." } }

translation1: "Tire choice for racing bikes - is it really as safe as they say? I've been eagerly awaiting today, as I wanted to train a bit for my upcoming cycling tour next week. So, I said and did it, and I rode my racing bike, which I bought yesterday on eBay.The first 40km were also really beautiful - but then what always lurks in every city center (this time: Thank you Krefeld!) happened. Glass shards on the route. Zack, loud hissing, and my rear tire didn't want to continue the rest of the way.Since I couldn't really buy a replacement jacket and hose due to the day of the week, I had to turn around with half-hearted mood and take the first train home. It wasn't quite as bad as it sounds, maybe it's better if I practice the tire change again before the bike tour. But now I'm facing a question and I hope you can help me.Since I have a relatively long distance to cover over several days, I would really hate to have this problem frequently. Now it wasn't that bad, as the old tires from the previous owner (a very nice old man who had driven until 2:12 PM on the day I picked up the bike and covered 140km!) were still on the bike, and he had already described them as suboptimal because he had driven many years on them. However, when I think that I still need to change the tires after 80-90km, I am not in a good mood: DNow I have come into conversation with an older man at the platform, who surprised me by asking why I didn't have the Marathon Plus tires; these are supposed to be unbeatable. Now it all sounds very tempting. But are they really so indestructible?I don't want to spend 40€/rear tire right now, just to be disappointed later. Furthermore, I wonder: I currently have 25x622 on my racing bike. Although it is also available (apparently) for Marathon Plus tires, the majority is already wider.Is this a problem? Or would you generally recommend other tires to me for a racing bike? The Schwalbe side seems to be my absolute favorite! I would rather recommend the Durano DD to those with less knowledge.Thank you already in advance for the help and loving greetings!"
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent with no grammatical errors, unnatural wording, or stiff syntax, making the meaning of the text clear and easy to understand. The language used is engaging, leaving the reader curious about the author's dilemma regarding the choice of tires. It is also emotionally impactful, due to the shared experience of a punctured tire on the cycling route." } }

translation1: "\"Party, die wir schmeißen wollten\": Frankfurt celebrates after a torrid comeback against Leverkusen. What a spectacular reaction from Eintracht Frankfurt. After 22 minutes, it seemed that the last twice-winless Hesse were on their way to another Bundesliga disaster.But then the SGE turned around and within an hour, the frustration from a mediocre season start was thrown off and they won furiously with 5:2. \"It's crazy what the guys have achieved today,\" jubilated coach Oliver Glasner to DAZN and gave a \"general compliment to everyone who was involved.\" It initially looked like another dampener for the Frankfurt team, who are still behind their expectations in ninth place. Patrik Schick had put Leverkusen ahead 2-0.What then happened, even impressed the SGE trainer. \"How the players then returned and showed a fantastic performance,\" Glasner continued. I am crazy happy with the performance we showed and of course with the result.Even defender Christopher Lenz, who was able to return to the field for the first time since the fourth game due to his recovered muscle injury, emphasized the morale of his teammates. \"I believe our mental attitude is incredible,\" said the 27-year-old, who was particularly pleased with the result for the fans. That was the party we wanted to throw today.For the upcoming tasks, Glasner wants to keep the focus on himself, but is also well-positioned in terms of personnel. It is exceptional that we have all players fit in December and that all players are in top physical condition. It is top work in our medical department, but the players also live highly professionally.Now we want to \"take it step by step and stay humble\" and complete the tasks until the end of the year \"at this level\". Next, there is already a away game scheduled for Wednesday as part of the English week against Borussia Mönchengladbach (18:30, Sky)."

translation1: "Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has constantly evolved, which among other things led to the combination of advanced modeling technology with the \"Valve Reactor\" circuit, which perfectly imitates the behavior of a tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X Amps, we are presenting a completely new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifiers wait with an authenticity that is absolutely impressive.Also do auch diese Amps den mehrstufigen Valvetronix-Röhrenvorverstärker enthalten. Dieser beruht teilweise auf echten analogen Schaltungen, weil diese die Klangvariationen und Nuancen eines Röhrenverstärkers einfach besser hinbekommen als jede Simulation. Zusätzlich zu dieser ausgeklügelten Schaltung bieten die VTX-Verstärker ein geschlossenes Gehäuse und ein Bassreflexsystem, aus dem die natürlichen Resonanzen nur so sprudeln.With the \"Tone Room\" software from VOX, you can even correct and bend historical facts on the virtual level, so that the amp and effects sound exactly as you have always imagined it. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is mainly due to the 2001 introduced VOX Valve Reactor technology. Of course, it has been refined several times since then to meet new sound requirements, which led to another performance boost of the VOX Valvetronix series in 2010 - with more dynamics as well as numerous and significantly improved amplifier models.From the handy VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series has been designed in such a way that all guitarists looking for maximum sound diversity will find what they're looking for. All guitarists dream of the compression and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, as well as prompt response. During a detailed analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the final stage determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor technology based on this finding.The valve reactor circuit of each VT+ amplifier perfectly reproduces the behavior, subtle nuances, and sound character of a tube amplifier."

translation1: "Federal Minister of Housing Klara Geywitz: Expropriation does not create any new apartments The new Federal Minister of Housing Klara Geywitz (SPD) has spoken out against the expropriation of large apartment complexes as demanded in a referendum in Berlin. \"With expropriation, no single new apartment is created, it only changes the ownership structure,\" said Geywitz in an interview with the \"Tagesspiegel\" (Sunday).My goal is to provide tenants with security that their rent will remain affordable in the next few years. A colorful mix of private landlords, cooperatives, or housing associations, by the way, is the best protection against monopolistic tendencies. In Berlin, the coalition of SPD, Greens, and Left Party plans to set up an expert commission to deal with the consequences of the people's vote.But if the situation does not calm down, Geywitz just concluded talks with the FDP in the Ampel coalition about further tightening of the rental law. The coalition agreement provides for a rental price brake until 2029, a limit on rent increases in tense housing markets, and the expansion of the rental index. I will speak with the Justice Minister to implement it as quickly as possible.If the rental market does not improve, \"we will discuss further steps with our coalition partners,\" emphasized the SPD politician."

translation1: "\"Why Children Are Not Tyrants\" Documentary, ARD Mediathek CW psychological violence, sexual abuse, power abuse The ARD documentary has surfaced in my Twitter timeline today, and I immediately watched it.The children's psychiatrist Michael Winterhoff is a popular guest on talk shows and gives lectures throughout Europe. With his book \"Why Our Children Become Tyrants\" (2008), he sparked a heated debate about upbringing. Former patients and those with parental authority are now making serious accusations against him.Please take care of yourselves, the film is difficult to watch. And I am very grateful that many people now think and act differently. Parents and other responsible adults should never, never, never have power over a child.Our goal must always be to give the child space for its development and to make the framework for the child as large as it is sensible and possible in the situation. Brrr, I still shiver."

translation1: "I am frustrated with Sky Sport F1 Hello dear F1 fans, the quality on the German Sky has decreased significantly throughout the season, so I want to vent a bit with this post. Firstly, the transmission was interrupted during the F2 race to ensure punctual F1 coverage.Although the schedule was significantly behind due to the delayed start and the crash at the beginning, it would still have been possible to show the last (planned) ten minutes as well as the championship decision. However, it seems that for legal reasons, F1 has priority and everything else has to be restricted, so Sky DE probably had no choice. Sky UK, on the other hand, broadcast the race until the end.Despite a small compliment: the commentator Olivier Zwartjes has accompanied the difficult situation around the heavy accident well. Then there was again a rule incompetence among the commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, so both did not know that you can change tires under a red flag. Although this situation occurred in Imola, Baku and Silverstone this year, both only came to the decision that Verstappen can change tires when there were corresponding radio messages to this topic to Hamilton.At Sky UK and RTL, both commentators immediately knew that there is a possibility for Verstappen. I believe that one should simply know such elementary rules when commenting on Formula 1 for a pay-TV broadcaster. It is also not the first riddle regarding what is now allowed or prescribed by the rules, both have simply had constant uncertainties in the topic of rules.Generally, I don't like the artificial commentary style of Roos, but I have to admit that it is a matter of taste. However, I find Heiko Wasser from RTL much better, even though I don't like his constant jokes, which make both of them appear unprofessional, such as ordering coffee at (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or \"UuuuuHD\" from Ralf Schumacher.The last one brings total chaos in the commentary, which he apparently does not take seriously. Not least, advertising simply takes over at Sky, and in the final stretch, Sky is the only channel that goes into advertising, as one can hear from F1TV after the race, where only the German soundtrack without commentary is available directly after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this.Both of these channels make less advertising during their training than Sky, and that as a free TV channel. Although I must praise Glock and Baumgartner for their work, this alone does not allow me to overlook the disadvantages. The rest of the Sky Sport F1 program is also very scarce and full of repeats.Overall, Sky is truly the worst German-speaking broadcaster for Formula 1. Ironically, RTL does a better job with the four races they are still allowed to transmit, except for the advertising. So, at least, the grandiose F1 season makes significantly less fun than it would be with a reasonable broadcaster.I would be interested in your opinion."

translation1: "Basketball Bundesliga: Debacle of MHP Riesen Ludwigsburg against Merlins Crailsheim At least Johannes Patrick was left. Again nothing: For the second time within less than three months, the Riesen lost in Crailsheim - and how!Before the game, Ludwigsburg's coach John Patrick looked back on the cup defeat in October at the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim and said: \"We still have some anger in our stomach.\" But this anger did not subside after the game - on the contrary, it was further fueled by the 61:72 (28:38) defeat in the Basketball Bundesliga. What was more disappointing than the bare result was the way the team performed.A substitute statistic is named, which expresses the entire dilemma: The triple quote amounted to just 13 percent, 4 goals (all scored by young Johannes Patrick) in 31 attempts - more questions? The answer was provided by John Patrick: \"We were not concentrated enough after our victory in Tenerife and did not implement what we had trained for, namely moving the ball.\"The reaction of his counterpart Sebastian Gleim was completely different: \"It was a great game to win for the second time against Ludwigsburg,\" said the happy coach. \"It felt like playing in front of 10,000 people.\" There were only 750 spectators in the Hohenlohe Arena on Saturday, but they made the most of it.Not least because of BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who marked 22 points and led his team's play. \"The best playmaker I have ever trained,\" praised Gleim. While Patrick's team's key performers, such as Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7), failed throughout the line.Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the giants prevent a total disaster and came within eight points, after they had already trailed by 39:59. Besides Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon also scored 12 points. Fortunately, there was plenty of time left for discussion.Already on Wednesday (7:00 PM), the giants receive the Skyliners Frankfurt, with a maximum of 750 spectators in Ludwigsburg before then."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent, grammatically correct, and has natural phrasing and syntax. "I find it generally unfair to expect children to take on a parenting role for their younger siblings. However, I think it's good for older siblings to help out with the younger ones to some extent. Maybe just a quick look, maybe just a quick assist, maybe bringing the juice box, etc.So they learn responsibility, help in the family, and are involved. As long as they can still take care of themselves, I see no problem. If your K1 spends the short time alone and it's okay for him, that's good too.You can best determine whether it is suitable for your children. It is not that he should twist K2 and accompany them for hours while they fall asleep. It is probably legally questionable.Maybe that's also the statement of the psychologist. After all, if something were to happen like a fire, break-in, earthquake, alien invasion, etc., it would actually be too much responsibility for K1 to take care of K2. Whether you want to take on this risk is, of course, up to you :)"

translation1: "A new 110-kV earth cable will be built in 2022. The approval for the laying of the new high-voltage cable at Tann is legally binding. The plan approval decision of the government of Lower Bavaria opens the way for the construction, which is scheduled to begin in 2022.The network operator Bayernwerk has announced that it will lay a 7-kilometer long underground cable. The cable will connect the transformer station Tann in the northern part of the community and the existing 110-kilovolt line between Simbach and Pfarrkirchen. The cable will be connected to a transmission tower of the overhead line near the village of Edermanning in Reut."

translation1: "Heavy \"Huidlerer\" question: Amberg knows the solution. What please is an \"Huidlerer\"? With this dialect word, sent by an Amberg resident, hefty thinking has been aroused in the BR television show \"Wir in Bayern\".But unlike on many previous days, the term in the series \"Host mi?\" was not guessed by the callers this time. No, it was not a \"nervous person\". And neither was it someone \"who everything has to go quickly for\".The people heard from the TV moderator that it was completely wrong. On which the man from Amberg provided the solution and probably also caused amazement among many Upper Palatinate people. \"The Huidlerer,\" the viewers learned, \"is a cloth used to wipe the oven.\"Dialect researcher Antony Rowley, who has been consulted as an expert by Bavarian Television for years, confirmed this. With the comment that this is a typical Upper Palatinate term, somehow derived from the more familiar dialect word \"Houdern\". With which a gap in education was closed - perhaps also for many who have been living in the Amberg area for a long time."

translation1: "Friedrich wins 60th World Cup event - Nolte wins two-man bob - Sport The brand of the Norwegian biathlete Ole Einar Björndalen with 94 victories is the goal of the bobsled pilot. \"I've calculated it, I would need to win nine and a half races per season to reach it by Cortina 2026,\" said the double Olympic champion from BSC Oberbärenburg, who scored two victories in two days at the races in Winterberg.First, he defended against Johannes Lochner's attack on Saturday by moving up from third to first place. Then he made some changes to the material settings and drove a larger gap on Sunday with 0.30 seconds. With his teammates Thorsten Margis (SV Halle), Candy Bauer (BSC Oberbärenburg), and Alexander Schüller (SV Halle), he beat the British Brad Hall.Third place went to Austrian Benjamin Maier. \"We went for a bigger risk today and were rewarded,\" said Friedrich, who also scored his 22nd consecutive victory. The Stuttgart-bound Berchtesgadener Johannes Lochner came in second place before this, but this time he finished in fifth place.Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach landed in eighth place after finishing fourth in the first race. \"If I knew what he did differently, I would also do it,\" said Lochner. Nolte won at home - Jamanka on the podium.Laura Nolte achieved her third season victory in the two-woman bob at home. After finishing only in fourth place in the monobob the day before, she raced to the World Cup victory with her pusher Deborah Levi on Sunday. Two-woman bob Olympic champion Mariama Jamanka from BRC Thüringen came in second with Germany's fastest sprinter, Alexandra Burghardt from Burghausen.You qualified for the Olympics alongside your first podium finish in this winter. Wiesbaden's Kim Kalicki finished in third place with Leonie Fiebig. It was super cool for me to get my first podium finish in the World Cup, and I'm super happy that Mariama is joining me.I am very happy with the development. There is still a lot of potential at the starting point, but the starting times today were okay,\" said Burghardt and emphasized, \"It's not just pushing, but there is also a lot of stuff around it.\" Jamanka was a bit annoyed about the not quite flawless runs, but said, \"It's going in the right direction.\""

"The LokSound 5 Decoder can reproduce up to 10 channels simultaneously. Each channel can be resolved here with up to 16 bits / 31250 kHz and offers high-quality sound on your installation. The large 128 Mbit sound buffer provides sufficient capacity. All individual noises can be individually adjusted in terms of volume.The highly flexible sound engine without a rigid schedule allows for the precise simulation of all conceivable railway vehicles. Three separately adjustable braking functions and two alternative load scenarios give you maximum control over your vehicles."
